bias_nature: Gender bias, with potential intersections of racial, class, and ability-related biases.
bias_justification: The text discusses the gendering of nationalism, highlighting how nationalism has been historically constructed as a masculine ideology that often excludes or marginalizes women's voices and experiences. It also discusses how some nationalist movements have reinforced traditional gender roles, relegating women to the private sphere as caregivers and supporters of the nation, while men are valorized as the protectors and defenders in the public sphere. This gendered division of labor and roles can contribute to the reinforcement of patriarchal norms within nationalist movements, potentially intersecting with other forms of bias such as racial, class, and ability-related biases.
